programme.title: Mégastructures romaines en Gaule
programme.desc:
In the heart of ancient Arles
During the conquest of Gaul, entire cities rallied the Roman cause without fighting, even enjoying the largesse of the emperors. A Unesco World Heritage site, Arles still bears witness to this past era: its amphitheatre a replica of the Coliseum, its circus one of the best known in Gaul.
Directed by: Claire Denavarre (France, 2021)

programme.title: Ô la belle vie
programme.desc: Lourdes behind the scenes Renowned world-wide for its pilgrimages, grotto, sanctuary and miracles, Lourdes is the second most-visited town in France, after Paris. Each year, 3.5 million visitors come to reflect and pray. It's also the gateway to the Pyrenees' major beauty spots and the innumerable leisure activities the mountains have to offer. Presented by: Sophie Jovillard.

programme.title: Silence, ça pousse !
programme.sub-title: Le bien et le mal dans la nature
programme.desc: Both good and evil in nature An encounter with Fabrice Desjours, artist and researcher who created the forest garden concept. An in-depth look at plants considered dangerous for man. Exploring the Grand-Lieu Lake in the Loire Atlantique. In Sophie's garden, how to bring mass planting to a city centre terrace? Presented by: Stéphane Marie, Carole Tolila.

programme.title: Mon plus beau village
programme.desc:
The final
Where will the crystal cup created by the Val-Saint-Lambert glassworks be proudly displayed this year? Discover the answer in the joyful company of the six ambassadors and Fanny Jandrain, in the enchanting setting of Les Sorbiers, in Heer.
Presented by: Fanny Jandrain.

programme.title: Version Française
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: La main à la pâte
programme.desc: Cranberries from Richibucto To the north of Bouctouche, near Richibucto, we find one of the largest cranberry farms in New Brunswick, belonging to Sylvain Cormier. And it's harvest time! Presenter: Luc Jean.

programme.title: #VF
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Les 100 lieux qu'il faut voir
programme.desc: The Landes, from Atlantic coast to Chalosse The seventh largest department in France by surface area, the Landes is appreciated for its sublime coastline, a veritable surfing paradise. Inland, Gascony stretches out its peaceful landscapes and lush rolling valleys: Chalosse. We meet an inventive restaurant-owner, music-loving botanists, a race-organiser... Directed by: François Chayé (season 4, France, 2017)

programme.title: Cap Sud-Ouest
programme.desc: Sarlat, heritage in its blood With seventy-five listed buildings in an area of only eleven hectares, Sarlat-la-Canéda, capital of the Périgord Noir, is renowned for having the highest density of historical monuments in the world. Éric Perrin invites you to join him in exploring the town and its incredibly rich heritage. Presented by: Éric Perrin.

programme.title: Vachement Normand !
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Ricardo
programme.desc:
Shortbread, clafoutis and chocolate clusters
For a speedy solution when you need a sugar fix, Ricardo presents three recipes that only take a few minutes and a single bowl to prepare: chocolate shortbread biscuits, cherry clafoutis and chocolate-coated blueberry-hazelnut clusters
Presented by: Ricardo Larrivée.

programme.title: Littoral
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Météo à la carte
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: L'épicerie
programme.sub-title: Séduire les employés... par le ventre
programme.desc:
The way to an employee's heart... through their stomach?
Does offering employees attractive meal options make good economic sense? Also on the programme: testing hand mixers; discovering ajvar, Balkan caviar; and a cake from Transylvania.
Presented by: Johane Despins.

Éric Perrin invites you to join him in exploring the town and its incredibly rich heritage. Presented by: Éric Perrin.

programme.title: Version Française
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: 5 chefs dans ma cuisine
programme.sub-title: Poulet Jerk et frites de bananes plantains
programme.desc: Jerk chicken and fried plantain chips Paul Toussaint shares his recipe for jerk chicken and makes plantain chips to accompany. Presented by: Marina Orsini. Directed by: Nicole Dussault, David Gauthier, Stéphane Rocheleau, Léo Boulanger (Canada, 2020)

programme.title: Le grand move
programme.desc: Manon and Alain, Magdalen Islands After having taken the decision to sell their duplex right in the heart of Montreal, Manon and Alain set their heading for the Magdalen Islands. Directed by: Mariloup Wolfe (Canada, 2020)

programme.title: Météo à la carte
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: L'épicerie
programme.desc:
Game meat
Venison, duck, boar, emu, elk, bison... What place does game have in our fridges today? Also on the programme: freeze-drying for zero waste; mascarpone, the king of Italian cream cheeses; and if, as they say, an army marches on its stomach, what do Canadian soldiers actually eat?
Presented by: Johane Despins.

programme.title: La peinture française autour du monde
programme.desc: La Courtauld Gallery, Londres La Courtauld Gallery est un musée d'art situé dans le Somerset House, sur le Strand, dans le centre de Londres. Grand collectionneur, visionnaire audacieux, l'industriel Samuel Courtauld a su choisir et promouvoir des artistes, jusque-là refusés par les grandes institutions, dont certains peintres impressionnistes, fauvistes ou cubistes. Réalisation : Jacques Vichet (France, 2020)

programme.title: Maestro !
programme.desc: Manon "Ah, what a beautiful diamond!" Exclaimed Manon, just before she died... Created at the Opéra-Comique in Paris in 1884, "Manon" by Jules Massenet, based on the novel by Abbé Prévost, was revived in 2020 by Vincent Huguet for a production at the Opéra Bastille. Presented by: Éric de Lochner. Directed by: Éric de Lochner (France, 2021)

programme.title: Les 100 lieux qu'il faut voir
programme.desc: The Alpes-Maritimes, from Grasse to the Mercantour An incredible diversity of décor and colour in the company of those who love their terroir, welcome to the Alpes-Maritimes! A fabulous journey to explore Grasse, world perfume capital, and the Pays de Vence with its typical villages. In the Mercantour, both animal and plant species are strictly protected. Directed by: Pierre Chassagnieux (season 4, France, 2017)

programme.title: Cap Sud-Ouest
programme.desc: Sarlat, heritage in its blood With seventy-five listed buildings in an area of only eleven hectares, Sarlat-la-Canéda, capital of the Périgord Noir, is renowned for having the highest density of historical monuments in the world. Éric Perrin invites you to join him in exploring the town and its incredibly rich heritage. Presented by: Éric Perrin.

programme.title: Louis et la faune urbaine
programme.desc:
Toronto, Ontario
Louis helps out at the house of someone who has involuntarily sheltered pigeons, squirrels and an entire family of raccoons.
Presenter: Louis Larose.

programme.title: Curieux Bégin
programme.desc: A little trip to Charlevoix Christian heads off to meet friends on the other side of the river, in the delightful region of Charlevoix. Pioneer in making the most of its terroir in terms of food, it offers a unique culinary trail under the expert guidance of the top chef Jean Soulard. Presented by: Christian Bégin.

programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: L'épicerie
programme.desc:
Natural wines
The market for natural wines is constantly growing... Farm-restaurants: a new trend? What's on the menu at a mi'kmaw wedding? Goji and açai berries, chia seeds, do all these so-called super foods really have miraculous properties?
Presented by: Johane Despins.

programme.title: Pays et marchés du monde
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Les 100 lieux qu'il faut voir
programme.desc: The Côtes-d'Armor, from the Côte d'Émeraude to the Île de Bréhat In Brittany, the Côte de Granit Rose and the Côte du Goëlo are fascinating geological curiosities. On the Île aux Moines, the vast colonies of seabirds are easy to observe, whilst the Île de Bréhat, known as the island of flowers, never fails to enchant all who love nature. Directed by: Florent Quet (season 4, France, 2017)

programme.title: Cap Sud-Ouest
programme.desc: Sarlat, heritage in its blood With seventy-five listed buildings in an area of only eleven hectares, Sarlat-la-Canéda, capital of the Périgord Noir, is renowned for having the highest density of historical monuments in the world. Éric Perrin invites you to join him in exploring the town and its incredibly rich heritage. Presented by: Éric Perrin.

programme.title: Une brique dans le ventre
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Épicerie fine
programme.desc:
The Espinouse Massif
In the Espinouse Massif, we meet Lilian and his swarm of bees. At the Les Taillades Farm, Aline and Guillaume have plenty to keep them busy, between caring for the animals and maturing the cheeses. All you need to know about the Pardailhan turnip; exploring the Hérépian Bell Museum.
Presented by: Guy Martin Directed by: Émilie Darnaud (France, 2022)

programme.title: La tête à l'endroit
programme.desc: Who understands Burgundian? Sandwiched between Paris and Lyon and spanning Burgundy's four départements, the Morvan area has own unique characteristics and customs. Can someone from Belfort, Jura or even Dijon understand the Burgundian language? Presenter: Guillaume Pierre.

programme.title: Météo à la carte
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: L'épicerie
programme.desc:
Spicing up the festive season!
Cinnamon, cloves, nutmeg and ginger add a characteristic touch to certain festive recipes. Discover the history of these exotic spices... Also on the programme: a buying guide for wine glasses; all about fonio, a new grain from Africa; and a compilation of twenty years of Christmas programmes from the archives!
Presented by: Johane Despins, Denis Gagné.
